reviews.review_msg: Not the best prof. I disagree that he is caring, and I didn't feel comfortable or confident in class. I don't know if that is because of the group of students, but it made me dread coming to class and tutorials. Though, I enjoyed the topics in the lecture.

As mentioned before, prof is a walking library on Ottoman history. Even more important, you walk away with some real insights when analyzing sources in the the tutorials. You need to do your readings prior to class to get the most out of this course. Prof has a very nice way of engaging with the class. Highly recommended. One of the best profs!

Expects the class to have previous knowledge of the topic despite no course prerequisites, also expects you have the same level of knowledge as him for the midterm and final. You are required to read an additional textbook to write your paper on. Tough class but doable if you put in the time. Recommended for those with a high interest in the topic.
Avoid like the Black Plague

Must attend lectures - lectures almost the entire time with few breaks. Heavy emphasis on readings, and there are MANY of them every week. Paper is slightly vague. Midterm was straightforward but he is a hard marker. A nice guy though and available for questions/help.

Never again am I going to take his class. Good luck, you're going to need it. He expects students to answer questions but all he response with is ok. Never tells if you are right or wrong. He even sometimes says what you just said after but in a more academic way. I wish someone would have told me about him before I took his class.

I found him to be extremely helpful, open to questions, comments and I took 2 classes with him. It would have been nice to have the exams back sooner but he has no TA. If you don't like or understand middle east/ islamic history then don't take his class:  he presumes prior knowledge as is stated in the syllabus and your ignorance is not his fault.

Very nice person and soft spoken. He helps you if you seek him out and is extremely knowledgeable in his field and speaks like 5 languages, which impresses me. However, he is a very difficult marker and wants you to pretty much write a textbook based on your notes and readings. Oh, and his lectures are very difficult to follow.
Nice guys expects alot but i like his exam style

Kuhn is a good prof, an interesting lecturer, and although he does assign a lot of readings they are usefull for the course.  He definately expects a lot of his students and the midterms/exams are not easy.  Definately learn how to include a lot of detail in your analyses.
boring personality, completely unorganized and all over the place, note taking is close to impossible, would not rec him unless you need to take his course.

terrible, awful, horrible prof. often late to class (5-20 minutes, w/out explanation). threw a HISSY FIT  over students not doing lecture readings. is a 300-lvl (not 100-lvl survey) prof & ought to be able to lecture w/out students having done readings. poor attitude towards students too. avoid unless course is requisite!
Overall this instructor was not the easiest. His attitude towards the students was poor. Basically the guy is a slacker that wants to do the minimum amount of work for a huge salary
the prof was not really helpful to students. Expects too much ffom the student. He's a bit arrogant and at times rude.
way too hard and biased

pretty good prof and class, he's a tough marker though, but he knows his material very well, and the lectures are generally pretty interesting. although his lecture style is alittle bit dry, but he's quite helpful and infomative when you ask him questions

interesting,but difficult course for those who have no background in middle east/ottoman hist.u learn a lot about ottoman+Turkish hist after taking this course. He is able to present material in a logical+clear way u can follow. Nice+kind, just gets angry sometimes. excellect lecturer+expert

I have no doubt that in a few yrs he will be a great prof. He has the knowledge and the passion. Tho he's monotone, bits and pieces of his personality shines thr at times. I've had worst profs. But right now, he sucks. If you don't mind being a guinea pig, then take his classes.
Extremely hard marker, boring lecturer. Very picky and detail oriented.
way too much work, too much to read. very boring, hard to follow in lectures. tutorials a waste of tiime. and hard marker!!
No Comments

Dr. Ghazal takes a straightforward approach in teaching and grading. Given that she teaches primarily 3rd and 4th year courses she expects students to perform their best in papers and writing. She values concision in writing. Visit her office hours to learn what she expects from you. Gives precise feedback, overall a good prof
Interesting lectures, but her style of teaching can be a mixed bag sometimes. Be prepared to take some initiative if you want to get a good grade.
No Comments
No Comments
